intro: Brucea sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran Brucea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly rough texture. Brucea sumatrensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
